definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: In taking such steps offenders are seeking forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 冒犯者以这种做出悔改的方式来寻求当事人的宽恕。

sentences.english: And your fussing makes not a particle of difference to the offender.
sentences.chinese: 而你的大吵大闹又不会给冒犯者造成甚么影响。

sentences.english: But they also found that women report more offenses than men.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们也发现女人冒犯他人的次数也比男人多。

sentences.english: Her speech affronted all of us.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话冒犯了我们大家。

sentences.english: The manner of folding a letter, for example, may embody a studied affront.
sentences.chinese: 比如信纸的折法，稍有不慎，就会被当做故意冒犯。

sentences.english: Or perhaps it was my somewhat sexually suggestive comments that offended?
sentences.chinese: 要不也许是我有点性暗示的回答冒犯了谁？

sentences.english: Don't offend a 24-year-old CEO with a large ad budget.
sentences.chinese: 不能用一大笔广告预算冒犯一个24岁的ceo。

sentences.english: The offending comment was in fact a heckle from an audience member.
sentences.chinese: 这番冒犯性的话实际上是一名观众的诘难。

sentences.english: Hukou reform was fine, but the government did not want to be hassled.
sentences.chinese: 户籍改革固然重要，但政府不希望被冒犯。

sentences.english: On one side I want to apologize to listeners who might have been offended.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我要向受冒犯的听众道歉。

sentences.english: Twice it is said that he is displeased.
The editor expunged all potentially offensive and derogatory material from the book.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删除了书中可能冒犯和贬损他人的内容。

sentences.english: Release your hatred. Forgive those who trespassed against you.
sentences.chinese: 放弃仇恨，宽恕那些冒犯你的人。

sentences.english: They were careful not to offend his nibs .
sentences.chinese: 他们小心翼翼，不敢冒犯这位大人。

sentences.english: I want be good to you, you know it.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我并无冒犯之意。

sentences.english: "The person you offend might end up being your boss next year, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 因为你冒犯的那个同事第二年可能就会成为你的上司。

definition: to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
